result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward L. Stoetzel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay Costs and DNA Surcharge. Bonds applied. Paid in full.

Huber privileges for work, counseling or any other reasons allowed are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.
Home monitor option after serving first 3 months, if eligible.  
Report today to set up start date and begin within 60 days.
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
11:21 a.m. Defendant Edward L. Stoetzel in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases 15CF160 and 15CF161 are heard for Initial Appearances and 15CF109 for a Motion Hearing.   ADA states a joint agreement has be reached and states on the record for all cases, but must first do initial appearances.

15CF160 and 15CF161:  Initial Appearances
Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaints and waived their readings.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.

15CF160 and 15CF161:  Preliminary Hearings
  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

15CF160 and 15CF161:  Arraingments:
  State files Informations.
Defendant received copy of informations.
Defendant waives reading of informations. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

15CF160 and 15CF161 and 15CF109:  Plea & Sentencing:
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
 
15CF160 and 15CF161 to be DRI. 
15CF109 CT 1: 6 mo Jail Sentence. Pay costs. Provide DNA Sample and pay DNA Surcharge. Any bond in these files be applied. 
15CF109 CT 2 to be DRI.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
No Contest for 15CF109 Ct 1

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF109 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 15CF109 Count 2, 15CF160 and 15CF161 are Dismissed and Read In.

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler concurs with the joint recommendation and requests 60 days to report to jail with Huber for work and has 1 day credit. 
State has no objection to 1 day credit.

BY THE COURT:*************Jail Sentence***
15CF109 CT 1: 6 mo Jail Sentence. 1 day credit.  Huber for work, Counseling, or any other reasons allowed.
Home monitor option after serving first 3 months, if eligible.  Report today to set up start date and begin within 60 days
Pay costs and DNA Surcharge. 
***Provide DNA Sample, if not done so already. 
Any bonds to be applied.
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Edward L. Stoetzel in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Matter is already set for a motion hearing on 5/7.

Defendant Edward L. Stoetzel in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Edward L. Stoetzel in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.
Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
Defendant can contact Public Defender for Representation
Court orders defendant to see Public Defender today. 
Bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances.
Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

ADA David Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of THC, Possession of Drug Paraphernalia.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $500 cash bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  4/6/15 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
